tasks.title: Plan your evening
tasks.notes: As you use Things to manage both your work and personal life, you‚Äôll find it convenient to set some of your to-dos aside for later in the day. Tap the calendar button below and choose ‚ÄúThis Evening‚Äù.

tasks.title: Make your to-dos repeat
tasks.notes:
There are some things you do every few days, weeks, or months. Create a repeating to-do and Things will automatically remind you on the right day. It‚Äôs a great time-saver, and makes you consistent!

To make a to-do repeat, tap ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ in the toolbar below and choose Repeat.

tasks.title: Convert to project
tasks.notes:
Sometimes you might create a to-do, but realize later that it‚Äôs actually a more complex project. No problem! In the toolbar below, tap ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ and choose Convert.

These checklist items will become to-dos inside your new project:

tasks.title: Tag your to-dos
tasks.notes:
Tags allow you to customize your workflow in Things.

For example, you can‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Use tags for places like ‚ÄúOffice‚Äù or ‚ÄúHome‚Äù.
‚Ä¢ Tag all your ‚ÄúErrands‚Äù.
‚Ä¢ Prioritize to-dos with an ‚ÄúImportant‚Äù tag.
‚Ä¢ Tag the things you‚Äôre working on with ‚ÄúKate‚Äù.
‚Ä¢ Or you can invent your own tags.

To add a tag, tap the tag button below. To see all to-dos with a given tag, use Quick Find to search for it.

tasks.title: Use timely reminders
tasks.notes:
It‚Äôs a great habit to check your Today list every morning to see what‚Äôs on your plate. But for those to-dos you absolutely cannot miss, adding reminders will give you peace of mind.

Tap the calendar button below, then tap Add Reminder, and set a time.

tasks.title: Go step by step
tasks.notes:
Break a to-do down into smaller steps by adding a checklist. You could use it to track a daily routine, pack a suitcase, make a grocery list, and so on.

And who knew it was so easy to make peanut butter cookies? üòÉ

tasks.title: Search and navigate
tasks.notes:
Finding things is super easy with Quick Find.

Collapse this to-do, scroll to the top of the project, and pull down to reveal search.

Then just start typing ‚Äì the name of a list, project, to-do, or tag ‚Äì and be taken there instantly.

tasks.title: Swipe for shortcuts
tasks.notes:
Want to quickly postpone a to-do?
‚Üí Swipe it right

Want to edit multiple to-dos at once?
‚Üê Swipe them left

Collapse this to-do and give it a try.

tasks.title: Quickly add to Inbox
tasks.notes: No matter which list you‚Äôre in, you can quickly add to-dos to your Inbox. Start dragging the plus button, then drop it on the Inbox shortcut that appears in the left corner.

tasks.title: Drag the plus button!
tasks.notes: That blue button you see at the bottom of each screen is more powerful than it looks ‚Äì it was made to move!

tasks.title: Sync your devices
tasks.notes:
Things Cloud keeps your to-dos in sync across your iPhone, iPad, and Mac. Go to Things‚Äô Settings ‚Üí Things Cloud to create a free account.

Even if you only use one device, you should still create a Things Cloud account ‚Äì this ensures your data is always safely backed up.

tasks.title: Enable the Today Widget
tasks.notes:
Things‚Äô widget lets you quickly view your Today list while working in other apps.

To enable it:

tasks.title: Enable the Action Extension
tasks.notes:
Things‚Äô Action Extension lets you quickly create to-dos from other apps.

To enable it:

tasks.title: Try using Siri with Things
tasks.notes: You can use Siri to quickly add new tasks or show a list. Go to Things‚Äô Settings ‚Üí Siri to turn it on.

tasks.title: Show your calendar events
tasks.notes: You can connect your calendars to Things and see all of your events and to-dos together. Go to Things‚Äô Settings ‚Üí Calendar Events to turn it on.

tasks.title: You‚Äôre done!
tasks.notes:
That‚Äôs all you really need to know. Feel free to start adding your own projects and to-dos.

You can come back to this project later to learn the advanced features below. When you‚Äôre done with it, complete it by tapping the progress ring at the top.

We hope you‚Äôll enjoy using Things!

tasks.title: Create a project
tasks.notes: On to bigger things! Leave this project and go back to your lists, then tap the blue plus button to add a project of your own.

tasks.title: Reorder your to-dos
tasks.notes: To reorder your list, tap and hold a to-do, then drag it to where it should go.

tasks.title: Plan this to-do for later
tasks.notes:
Tap the calendar button again, but this time, choose a date in the future. It will automatically appear in your Today list when the day comes.

Upcoming to-dos are grouped together at the bottom of each section.

tasks.title: Put this to-do in Today
tasks.notes: Tap the calendar button below to decide when you‚Äôll do this to-do. Choose Today.

tasks.title: Create a new to-do
tasks.notes: Your turn ‚Äì collapse this to-do, then tap the blue ‚Äú+‚Äù button.

tasks.title: Tap this to-do
tasks.notes: You‚Äôre looking at a to-do! Complete it by tapping the checkbox on the left. Completed to-dos are collected at the bottom of your project.

tasks.title: Any questions? We‚Äôre here to help!
tasks.notes:
If you have any questions, we have a great collection of support articles on our website. You can also send us a message and we‚Äôll be glad to help!

tasks.title: Learn some keyboard shortcuts
tasks.notes:
To explore all of Things‚Äô shortcuts, go to Help ‚Üí Keyboard Shortcuts. Here are the most important ones:

‚åòS: choose when to start a to-do
‚åòT: mark a to-do as Today
‚åò‚áßM: move a to-do to another list

‚åò‚Üë: move a to-do up
‚åò‚Üì: move a to-do down

tasks.title: Make your to-dos repeat
tasks.notes:
There are some things you do every few days, weeks, or months. Create a repeating to-do and Things will automatically remind you on the right day. It‚Äôs a great time-saver, and makes you consistent!

To create one, go to File ‚Üí New Repeating To-Do.

tasks.title: Convert a to-do into a project
tasks.notes:
Sometimes you might create a to-do, but realize later that it‚Äôs actually a more complex project. No problem! In the toolbar below, click ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ and choose Convert to Project.

These checklist items will be become to-dos inside your new project:

tasks.title: Open multiple windows
tasks.notes: As you organize your to-dos, it can be very helpful to have multiple lists open side by side. Right-click any list in the sidebar to open it in a new window.

tasks.title: Hide the sidebar to focus on your work
tasks.notes: Work without any distractions by hiding your sidebar. Just drag the sidebar handle all the way to the left, or hit ‚åò/

tasks.title: Plan your evening
tasks.notes: As you use Things to manage both your work and personal life, you‚Äôll find it convenient to set some of your to-dos aside for later in the day. Click the calendar button below and choose ‚ÄúThis Evening‚Äù.

tasks.title: Add a reminder so you won‚Äôt forget
tasks.notes:
It‚Äôs a great habit to check your Today list every morning to see what‚Äôs on your plate. But for those to-dos you absolutely cannot miss, adding reminders will give you peace of mind.

Click the calendar button below and type ‚ÄúMonday 3pm‚Äù.

tasks.title: Go step by step with checklists
tasks.notes:
Break a to-do down into smaller steps by adding a checklist. You could use it to track a daily routine, pack a suitcase, make a grocery list, and so on.

And who knew it was so easy to make peanut butter cookies? üòÉ

tasks.title: Tag your to-dos
tasks.notes:
Tags allow you to customize your workflow in Things.

For example, you can‚Ä¶
‚Ä¢ Use tags for places like ‚ÄúOffice‚Äù or ‚ÄúHome‚Äù.
‚Ä¢ Tag all your ‚ÄúErrands‚Äù.
‚Ä¢ Prioritize to-dos with an ‚ÄúImportant‚Äù tag.
‚Ä¢ Tag the things you‚Äôre working on with ‚ÄúKate‚Äù.
‚Ä¢ Or you can invent your own tags.

To add a tag, click the tag button below. To see all to-dos with a given tag, use Quick Find to search for it.

tasks.title: Search and navigate with Quick Find
tasks.notes: Finding things is super easy with Quick Find. Collapse this to-do, and then just start typing ‚Äì the name of a list, project, to-do, or tag ‚Äì and be taken there instantly.

tasks.title: Link to emails, files, and web pages
tasks.notes:
You can link to emails, files, and web pages by simply dragging them into the notes of a to-do.

Even better, you can use Quick Entry‚Äôs Autofill feature to do it automatically. To enable Autofill, go to Things ‚Üí Preferences ‚Üí Quick Entry.

tasks.title: Add to-dos from anywhere
tasks.notes: No matter which app you‚Äôre in, you can use Quick Entry to add to-dos to Things. Try it now by hitting Ctrl+Space.

tasks.title: Sync your devices
tasks.notes:
Things Cloud keeps your to-dos in sync across your Mac, iPhone, and iPad. Go to Things ‚Üí Preferences ‚Üí Things Cloud to create a free account.

Even if you only use one device, you should still create a Things Cloud account ‚Äì this ensures your data is always safely backed up.

tasks.title: Enable the Today Widget
tasks.notes:
Things‚Äô widget lets you quickly view your Today list while working in other apps.

To enable it:

tasks.title: Show your calendar events
tasks.notes: You can connect your calendars to Things and see all of your events and to-dos together. Go to Things ‚Üí Preferences ‚Üí Calendar Events to turn it on.

tasks.title: You‚Äôre done!
tasks.notes:
That‚Äôs all you really need to know. Feel free to start adding your own projects and to-dos.

You can come back to this project later to learn the advanced features below. When you‚Äôre done with the project, complete it by clicking the progress ring at the top.

We hope you‚Äôll enjoy using Things!

tasks.title: Create a project
tasks.notes: On to bigger things! At the bottom of the sidebar, click ‚Äú+ New List‚Äù to add a project of your own.

tasks.title: Create a new heading
tasks.notes: Go to File ‚Üí New Heading to create a heading, then drag a to-do under it.

tasks.title: Plan this to-do for later
tasks.notes:
Click the calendar button again, but this time, choose a date in the future. It will automatically appear in your Today list when the day comes.

Upcoming to-dos are grouped together at the bottom of each section.

tasks.title: Add this to-do to your Today list
tasks.notes: Click the calendar button below to plan when you‚Äôll do this to-do. Choose Today.

tasks.title: Create a new to-do
tasks.notes: Your turn ‚Äì just hit ‚åòN on your keyboard.

tasks.title: Double-click this to-do
tasks.notes: You‚Äôre looking at a to-do! Complete it by clicking the checkbox on the left. Completed to-dos are collected at the bottom of your project.

projects.title: Meet Things iOS
projects.notes: This project shows you everything you need to know to hit the ground running. Don‚Äôt hesitate to play around in it ‚Äì you can always create a new one from settings.
